channel.title: [Pi]Home Teleport[Pi]
channel.description: I made my new home, but I can't figure out how to change the new home teleport to it. I searched so hard, and cannot find. Please help! :(

item.title: [Pi]Home Teleport[Pi]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]The startTeleport method has to have a gfx function.

You must add “modern” or “ancient” to the end.

Here:

Ancients:

c.getPA().startTeleport(2110, 3915, 0, "ancient");

Modern:

c.getPA().startTeleport(2110, 3915, 0, "modern"); [/quote]
Bahh! You help too much! Repped!

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi]Home Teleport[Pi]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

this is the code I put in:

//home teleports case 4171: case 50056: case 117048: String type = c.playerMagicBook == 0 ? "modern" : "ancient"; c.getPA().startTeleport(2110, 3915, 0); break;

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi]Home Teleport[Pi]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

Facepalm Well I found the home teleport…And this source’s home was edgeville:

//home teleports case 4171: case 50056: case 117048: String type = c.playerMagicBook == 0 ? "modern" : "ancient"; c.getPA().startTeleport(Config.EDGEVILLE_X, Config.EDGEVILLE_Y, 0, type); break;
Sigh What code would I replace

c.getPA().startTeleport(Config.EDGEVILLE_X, Config.EDGEVILLE_Y, 0, type);

with? Like “xxxx” and “yyyy”…

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi]Home Teleport[Pi]
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

find the coords of your old home, search them in clickingmost or clickingbuttons, and change them.

Read full topic
